docs.lead_paragraph: The White House said on Monday that it expects final enrollment numbers for private health care insurance under Obamacare in 2014 to be "substantially larger" than 6 million after a busy final weekend of in-person and online signups.

headline.main: White House Sees Obamacare Sign-Ups 'Substantially Larger' Than Six Million
headline.print_headline: White House Sees Obamacare Sign-Ups 'Substantially Larger' Than Six Million

docs.snippet: The White House said on Monday that it expects final enrollment numbers for private health care insurance under Obamacare in 2014 to be "substantially larger" than 6 million after a busy final weekend of in-person and online signups.

docs.lead_paragraph: Like so much about the government's health care overhaul, Monday's deadline to sign up for coverage in 2014 didn't turn out quite as planned: Many people still are eligible for extensions that will let them enroll.

headline.main: Q&A: Status Update as Health Law Marks a Milestone

docs.snippet: Like so much about the government's health care overhaul, Monday's deadline to sign up for coverage in 2014 didn't turn out quite as planned: Many people still are eligible for extensions that will let them enroll.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. administration said key segments of its Obamacare website, HealthCare.gov, were unavailable to new users for a second time on Monday, as record numbers of people tried to access the site hours before the enrollment deadline for health insurance.

headline.main: U.S. Says HealthCare.gov Functions Unavailable to New Users

headline.main: An Owner Asks a Question About Offering Employees a Stipend to Buy Health Coverage

headline.main: Today in Small Business: Killing DailyCandy

docs.abstract: HealthCare.Gov malfunctions on the last day to sign up. The extra perks it takes to hire technology talent. And business owners in Las Vegas share their “goofs, gaffes and miscalculations.”

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday declined to take up preliminary appeals brought by Roman Catholic groups that want an exemption from part of President Barack Obama's healthcare law requiring employers to provide insurance that covers contraception.

headline.main: Supreme Court Declines to Hear New Contraception Cases
headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Declines to Hear New Contraception Cases

docs.snippet: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday declined to take up preliminary appeals brought by Roman Catholic groups that want an exemption from part of President Barack Obama's healthcare law requiring employers to provide insurance that covers contraception.

docs.lead_paragraph: The federal website for U.S. consumers to enroll in private health insurance under Obamacare ran into problems twice on Monday because of a surge of people trying to access the site hours before a midnight deadline to sign up for coverage.

headline.main: Obamacare Website Stalls a Bit Before Enrollment Deadline
headline.print_headline: Obamacare Website Stalls a Bit Before Enrollment Deadline

docs.snippet: The federal website for U.S. consumers to enroll in private health insurance under Obamacare ran into problems twice on Monday because of a surge of people trying to access the site hours before a midnight deadline to sign up for coverage.

docs.lead_paragraph: Beating expectations, President Barack Obama's health care overhaul was on track to sign up more than 7 million Americans for health insurance on deadline day Monday, government officials told The Associated Press.

headline.main: AP Sources: Health Law Sign-Ups on Track to Hit 7M
headline.print_headline: AP Sources: Health Law Sign-Ups on Track to Hit 7M

docs.snippet: Beating expectations, President Barack Obama's health care overhaul was on track to sign up more than 7 million Americans for health insurance on deadline day Monday, government officials told The Associated Press.
